meanings.definition: A small, enclosed space or pen for livestock.
meanings.sent1: The farmer led the sheep into the cudden for the night.
meanings.sent2: The chickens roamed freely outside the cudden during the day.
meanings.sent3: The piglet tried to hide in the cudden to avoid getting a bath.
meanings.sent4: The cudden was a safe haven for the young lambs during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The cows gathered peacefully in the cudden at dusk.

meanings.sent1: She loved to cudden her teddy bear before going to sleep.
meanings.sent2: The couple would often cudden on the couch while watching movies.
meanings.sent3: The puppy would cudden up to its owner whenever it felt scared.
meanings.sent4: The siblings would cudden each other tightly after being apart for so long.
meanings.sent5: The mother would cudden her child to comfort them when they were sad.

meanings.sent1: The loud noise was a cudden that startled the birds in the trees.
meanings.sent2: The cudden of thunder made the children run inside for cover.
meanings.sent3: The cudden of rain caught the hikers off guard during their trek.
meanings.sent4: The cudden of applause surprised the actor on stage.
meanings.sent5: The cudden of laughter filled the room with joy.
